blocks.name: bj-2alim
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ 2alimi . (Contributed by BJ, 6-May-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-2exim
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ 2eximi . (Contributed by BJ, 6-May-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-alanim
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ alanimi . (Contributed by BJ, 6-May-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-2albi
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ 2albii . (Contributed by BJ, 6-May-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-notalbii
blocks.content: Equivalence of universal quantification of negation of equivalent formulas. Shortens ~ ab0 (103>94), ~ ballotlem2 (2655>2648), ~ bnj1143 (522>519), ~ hausdiag (2119>2104). (Contributed by BJ, 17-Jul-2021.)

blocks.name: bj-2exbi
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ 2exbii . (Contributed by BJ, 6-May-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-3exbi
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ 3exbii . (Contributed by BJ, 6-May-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-sylgt2
blocks.content: Uncurried (imported) form of ~ sylgt . (Contributed by BJ, 2-May-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-exlimh
blocks.content: Closed form of close to ~ exlimih . (Contributed by BJ, 2-May-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-exlimh2
blocks.content: Uncurried (imported) form of ~ bj-exlimh . (Contributed by BJ, 2-May-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-exlalrim
blocks.content: Adding an existential quantifier in the antecedent and a universal quantifier in the consequent of an implication. Note that the half of the proof using the antecedent ` F/ x ph ` does not require ~ ax-gen . See also ~ 19.38a and ~ 19.38b . (Contributed by BJ, 27-Nov-2022.)

blocks.name: bj-alexim
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ aleximi (with a shorter proof, so ~ aleximi could be deduced from it --- ~ exim would have to be proved first, but its proof is shorter (currently almost a subproof of ~ aleximi )). (Contributed by BJ, 8-Nov-2021.)

blocks.name: bj-nexdh
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ nexdh (actually, its general instance). (Contributed by BJ, 6-May-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-nexdh2
blocks.content: Uncurried (imported) form of ~ bj-nexdh . (Contributed by BJ, 6-May-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-hbxfrbi
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ hbxfrbi . Notes: it is less important than ~ nfbiit ; it requires ~ sp (unlike ~ nfbiit ); there is an obvious version with ` ( E. x ph -> ph ) ` instead. (Contributed by BJ, 6-May-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-exlime
blocks.content: Variant of ~ exlimih where the nonfreeness of ` x ` in ` ps ` is expressed using an existential quantifier, thus requiring fewer axioms. (Contributed by BJ, 17-Mar-2020.)

blocks.name: bj-exnalimn
blocks.content: A transformation of quantifiers and logical connectives. The general statement that ~ equs3OLD proves. This and the following theorems are the general instances of already proved theorems. They could be moved to the main part, before ~ ax-5 . I propose to move to the main part: ~ bj-exnalimn , ~ bj-exalim , ~ bj-exalimi , ~ bj-exalims , ~ bj-exalimsi , ~ bj-ax12i , ~ bj-ax12wlem , ~ bj-ax12w , and remove ~ equs3OLD . A new label is needed for ~ bj-ax12i and label suggestions are welcome for the others. I also propose to change ` -. A. x -. ` to ` E. x ` in ~ speimfw and ~ spimfw (other spim* theorems use ` E. x ` and very few theorems in set.mm use ` -. A. x -. ` ). (Contributed by BJ, 29-Sep-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-exalim
blocks.content: Distributing quantifiers over a double implication. (Contributed by BJ, 8-Nov-2021.)

blocks.name: bj-exalimi
blocks.content: An inference for distributing quantifiers over a double implication. The canonical derivation from its closed form ~ bj-exalim (using ~ mpg ) has fewer essential steps, but more steps in total (yielding a longer compressed proof). (Almost) the general statement that ~ speimfw proves. (Contributed by BJ, 29-Sep-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-exalims
blocks.content: Distributing quantifiers over a double implication. (Almost) the general statement that ~ spimfw proves. (Contributed by BJ, 29-Sep-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-exalimsi
blocks.content: An inference for distributing quantifiers over a double implication. (Almost) the general statement that ~ spimfw proves. (Contributed by BJ, 29-Sep-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-ax12ig
blocks.content: A lemma used to prove a weak form of the axiom of substitution. A generalization of ~ bj-ax12i . (Contributed by BJ, 19-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: bj-ax12i
blocks.content: A weakening of ~ bj-ax12ig that is sufficient to prove a weak form of the axiom of substitution ~ ax-12 . The general statement of which ~ ax12i is an instance. (Contributed by BJ, 29-Sep-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-nfimt
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ nfim and curried (exported) form of ~ nfimt . (Contributed by BJ, 20-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-nfimt(setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wnf(s0, w0), wi(wnf(s0, w1), wnf(s0, wi(w0, w1))))
} = {
  syl6ibr(wnf(s0, w0), wnf(s0, w1), wnf(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wi(wex(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wal(s0, wi(w0, w1))))
  syl9(wnf(s0, w0), wnf(s0, w1), wex(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wal(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wi(wex(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1)))
  syl5bi(wnf(s0, w0), wex(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wi(wex(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1)), wi(wal(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1)))
  19.35(s0, w0, w1)
  imim1d(wnf(s0, w0), wal(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1), wex(s0, w0))
  nfrd(s0, wnf(s0, w0), w0)
  id(wnf(s0, w0))
  syl6(wnf(s0, w1), wi(wex(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1)), wal(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wi(wex(s0, w0), wal(s0, w1)))
  imim2d(wnf(s0, w1), wex(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1), wal(s0, w1))
  nfrd(s0, wnf(s0, w1), w1)
  id(wnf(s0, w1))
  19.38(s0, w0, w1)
  df-nf(s0, wi(w0, w1))
}

blocks.name: bj-cbvalimt
blocks.content: A lemma in closed form used to prove ~ bj-cbval in a weak axiomatization. (Contributed by BJ, 12-Mar-2023.) Do not use ~ 19.35 since only the direction of the biconditional used here holds in intuitionistic logic. (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-cbvalimt(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wi(wal(s0, wex(s1, w0)), wi(wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(w0, wi(w1, w2)))), wi(wi(wal(s1, w1), wal(s0, wal(s1, w1))), wi(wal(s0, wi(wex(s1, w2), w2)), wi(wal(s1, w1), wal(s0, w2))))))
} = {
  syl6com(wal(s0, wex(s1, w0)), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(w0, wi(w1, w2)))), wi(wi(wal(s1, w1), wal(s0, wal(s1, w1))), wi(wal(s0, wi(wex(s1, w2), w2)), wi(wal(s1, w1), wal(s0, w2)))), wal(s0, wex(s1, wi(w1, w2))))
  al2imi(s0, wal(s1, wi(w0, wi(w1, w2))), wex(s1, w0), wex(s1, wi(w1, w2)))
  exim(s1, w0, wi(w1, w2))
  3syl(wal(s0, wex(s1, wi(w1, w2))), wi(wi(wal(s1, w1), wal(s0, wal(s1, w1))), wi(wal(s0, wi(wex(s1, w2), w2)), wi(wal(s1, w1), wal(s0, w2)))), wal(s0, wi(wal(s1, w1), wex(s1, w2))), wi(wal(s0, wal(s1, w1)), wal(s0, wex(s1, w2))))
  alimi(s0, wex(s1, wi(w1, w2)), wi(wal(s1, w1), wex(s1, w2)))
  com12(wex(s1, wi(w1, w2)), wal(s1, w1), wex(s1, w2))
  aleximi(s1, w1, wi(w1, w2), w2)
  pm2.27(w1, w2)
  alim(s0, wal(s1, w1), wex(s1, w2))
  com23(wi(wal(s0, wal(s1, w1)), wal(s0, wex(s1, w2))), wi(wal(s1, w1), wal(s0, wal(s1, w1))), wal(s0, wi(wex(s1, w2), w2)), wi(wal(s1, w1), wal(s0, w2)))
  syl56(wi(wal(s0, wal(s1, w1)), wal(s0, wex(s1, w2))), wal(s0, wi(wex(s1, w2), w2)), wi(wi(wal(s1, w1), wal(s0, wal(s1, w1))), wi(wal(s1, w1), wal(s0, w2))), wi(wal(s0, wex(s1, w2)), wal(s0, w2)), wi(wal(s0, wal(s1, w1)), wal(s0, w2)))
  alim(s0, wex(s1, w2), w2)
  imim1(wal(s0, wal(s1, w1)), wal(s0, wex(s1, w2)), wal(s0, w2))
  imim2(wal(s0, wal(s1, w1)), wal(s0, w2), wal(s1, w1))
}

blocks.name: bj-cbveximt
blocks.content: A lemma in closed form used to prove bj-cbvex in a weak axiomatization. (Contributed by BJ, 12-Mar-2023.) Do not use ~ 19.35 since only the direction of the biconditional used here holds in intuitionistic logic. (Proof modification is discouraged.)
